newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila stocks rebound at close after rate cut.
newsitem.headline: Manila stocks rebound at close after rate cut.

text.p: Manila stocks jumped out of negative territory at the close on Monday after the Central Bank effectively cut its overnight borrowing rate to 22 percent from 25 percent, traders said.
"The foreign exchange market seems to be simmering down with the rate cut," said Henry Ong, research head at Sapphire Securities.
The composite index ended 19.52 points higher, or by 0.76 percent, to 2,592.21. Early in the session, the index dropped to a day's low of 2,558.78.
But other traders viewed the rebound more of a technical rally after the index lost more than 83 points in the past three days.
Traders said they do not expect the market to sustain its rally for the rest of the week due to uncertainties on the foreign exchange market and first half earnings of companies.
"Interest rates are still high even with the three-percentage point slash in the Central Bank's key rate," said Joey Roxas, president of Eagle Equities. "Market investors want to see further cuts."
Gainers outpaced losers 63 to 56, with prices of 51 issues remaining unchanged.-- DOLLY AGLAY (63 2) 841-8936, Fax 817-6267
